        public PullImageCallback pullImage(@NotNull
                                   @NotNull java.lang.String image,

        Pulls an image from a registry, Docker Hub by default.
        /!\ If you don't want to use a param marked as optional, simply pass null.
        Parameters:
        image - The image to pull.
        tag - The tag of the image to pull (optional).
        Returns:
        The callback.

      • pullImage

        public PullImageCallback pullImage(@NotNull
                                   @NotNull java.lang.String image,
                                   java.lang.String tag,
                                   java.lang.String platform,
                                   java.lang.String registry,
                                   com.github.dockerjava.api.model.AuthConfig auth)
        Pulls an image from a registry, Docker Hub by default.
        /!\ If you don't want to use a param marked as optional, simply pass null.
        Parameters:
        image - The image to pull.
        tag - The tag of the image to pull (optional).
        platform - The platform of the image to pull (optional).
        registry - The registry to pull the image from (optional).
        auth - The authentication to use (optional).
        Returns:
        The callback.

      • pushImage

        public PushImageCallback pushImage(@NotNull
                                   @NotNull java.lang.String image,
                                   java.lang.String tag,
                                   com.github.dockerjava.api.model.AuthConfig auth)
        Push an image to a registry.
        /!\ If you don't want to use a param marked as optional, simply pass null.
        Parameters:
        image - The image to push, with the repository and the registry if needed.
        Example: "ghcr.io/nullptr-rs/my-image" for custom registry, "nullptr-rs/my-image" or "my-image" if the registry is Docker Hub.
        tag - The tag of the image to push (optional).
        auth - The authentication to use (optional).
        Returns:
        The callback.

        Search for an image.
        /!\ If you don't want to use a param marked as optional, simply pass null.
        Parameters:
        term - The term to search for.
        limit - The maximum number of results to return (optional).
        Returns:
        The list of results.

      • removeImage

        public void removeImage(@NotNull
                        @NotNull java.lang.String image,
                        java.lang.Boolean force,
                        java.lang.Boolean dontRemoveParents)
        Remove a pulled image.
        /!\ If you don't want to use a param marked as optional, simply pass null.
        Parameters:
        image - The image to remove, with the repository and the registry if needed.
        force - Force the removal of the image (optional).
        dontRemoveParents - true to don't remove the parent images (optional).

      • listImages

        public java.util.List<com.github.dockerjava.api.model.Image> listImages(java.lang.Boolean showAll,
                                                                        java.lang.String nameFilter)
        List pulled images.
        /!\ If you don't want to use a param marked as optional, simply pass null.
        Parameters:
        showAll - true to show all images (optional).
        nameFilter - The name filter to use (optional).
        Returns:
        The list of pulled images.

      • saveImage

        public java.io.InputStream saveImage(@NotNull
                                     @NotNull java.lang.String image,
                                     java.lang.String tag)
        Save an image to a tar archive.
        /!\ If you don't want to use a param marked as optional, simply pass null.
        /!\ Warning: Don't forget to close the stream after usage to avoid memory leaks.
        Parameters:
        image - The image to save, with the repository and the registry if needed.
        tag - The tag to save (optional).
        Returns:
        The stream to the tar archive.

      • saveImages

        public java.io.InputStream saveImages(@NotNull
                                      @NotNull java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> images)
        Save multiples images to a tar archive.
        /!\ Warning: Don't forget to close the stream after usage to avoid memory leaks.
        Parameters:
        images - The images to save, with the repository and the registry if needed. The map key is the image name, the map value is the tag.
        Returns:
        The stream to the tar archive.

      • buildImage

        public BuildImageCallback buildImage(@NotNull
                                     @NotNull java.io.File dockerfile,
                                     java.lang.String[] tags)
        Build an image from a Dockerfile.
        /!\ If you don't want to use a param marked as optional, simply pass null.
        Parameters:
        dockerfile - The Dockerfile to build.
        tags - The tags to apply to the image (optional).
        Returns:
        The callback.

      • buildImage

        public BuildImageCallback buildImage(@NotNull
                                     @NotNull java.io.File dockerfile,
                                     java.lang.String[] tags,
                                     java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> metadata,
                                     java.lang.Boolean remove,
                                     java.lang.String platform,
                                     java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> buildArgs)
        Build an image from a Dockerfile.
        /!\ If you don't want to use a param marked as optional, simply pass null.
        Parameters:
        dockerfile - The Dockerfile to build.
        tags - The tags to apply to the image (optional).
        metadata - The metadata to apply to the image (optional).
        remove - true to remove intermediate containers (optional).
        platform - The platform to build for (optional).
        buildArgs - The build arguments to apply to the image, with the key as the argument name and the value as the argument value (optional).
        Returns:
        The callback.

      • tagImage

        public void tagImage(@NotNull
                     @NotNull java.lang.String imageName,
                     @NotNull
                     @NotNull java.lang.String repository,
                     @NotNull
                     @NotNull java.lang.String tag,
                     java.lang.Boolean force)
        Tag an image.
        /!\ If you don't want to use a param marked as optional, simply pass null.
        Parameters:
        imageName - The image to tag.
        repository - The repository to tag the image to.
        tag - The tag to tag the image to.
        force - true to force the tagging (optional).
